segments.en: Hello English learners.
Welcome back to another great lesson with EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到另一个精彩的EnglishPod课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you another great lesson about being at the bank.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来关于银行的精彩课程。

segments.en: That's right.
We've got an intermediate lesson for you today with lots of great language to help you open a bank account.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节中级课程，包含很多有用的语言，帮助您开设银行账户。

segments.en: Okay, so let's look at our vocabulary preview today.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看今天的词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
Two words today.
The first one is checking account.
A checking account.
Checking account.
So what is a checking account?
Well, it's a type of bank account that lets you do your day-to-day or daily banking.
segments.cn: 这是一个让您进行日常银行业务的银行账户。

segments.en: So it's the normal bank account that you use to go shopping, that you use to pay your bills.
segments.cn: 所以这是您用来购物和支付账单的普通银行账户。

segments.en: Yep, exactly.
The opposite and our second word is savings account.
segments.cn: 相对的，第二个词是储蓄账户。

segments.en: A savings account.
So a savings account is to...?
It's a bank account where you save your money.
segments.cn: 这是一个您存钱的银行账户。

segments.en: To save money, right?
So usually you don't touch the money in this account.
segments.cn: 所以通常您不会动用这个账户里的钱。

segments.en: Yeah, usually it stays in there.
segments.cn: 是的，通常它会留在里面。

segments.en: Right, so usually banks will have these two types of accounts.
segments.cn: 对，所以通常银行会有这两种类型的账户。

segments.en: Yes.
Checking and savings.
Okay, great.
Let's listen to our dialogue a first time now.
segments.cn: 现在让我们第一次听对话。

segments.en: Right, well today we're at a bank and we're going to listen as a man is opening a bank account.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们在一家银行，我们将听一个人开设银行账户。

segments.en: The dialogue is going to be spoken at a normal speed, so it might be a little bit fast.
segments.cn: 对话将以正常速度进行，所以可能会有点快。

segments.en: Yeah.
But don't worry about it because we'll come back and explain everything.
segments.cn: 但不用担心，因为我们会回来解释一切。

segments.en: Yes.
Next, please.
May I help you, sir?
Hello, yes, I'd like to open a bank account.
segments.cn: 你好，是的，我想开一个银行账户。

segments.en: Certainly, I can help you with that.
What type of account would you like to open?
A checking or a saving account?
segments.cn: 支票账户还是储蓄账户？

segments.en: What features do they offer?
Well, if you just take a look here, see, with our checking account, you can have unlimited daily transactions for a small monthly fee.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果您看看这里，您会看到我们的支票账户，您可以享受无限的日常交易，只需支付少量月费。

segments.en: And our savings account has a higher interest rate.
segments.cn: 而我们的储蓄账户则有更高的利率。

segments.en: But you must carry a minimum balance of $10,000.
segments.cn: 但您必须保持最低余额为10,000美元。

segments.en: I see.
Well, I think I'm more interested in a checking account.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我更感兴趣的是支票账户。

segments.en: I'd like to have easy access to my money.
segments.cn: 我想方便地访问我的钱。

segments.en: All right, then.
With this checking account, you'll be issued a debit card and a checkbook.
segments.cn: 使用这个支票账户，您将获得一张借记卡和一本支票簿。

segments.en: Will you require overdraft protection?
There is an extra fee for that.
No, that won't be necessary.
In that case, I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll need your social insurance number and two pieces of government ID.
segments.cn: 我需要您的社会保险号码和两份政府身份证明。

segments.en: If.
you could just sign here, and here, and here, we'll be all set.
segments.cn: 您可以在这里、这里和这里签名，我们就可以了。

segments.en: Would you like to make a deposit today?
Yes, I'd like to deposit one billion dollars!
One billion dollars!
All right, one billion dollars.
That's a weird laugh.
Okay, let's look at language takeaway today.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看今天的语言要点。

segments.en: Today we've got four words for you in language takeaway, all about money and banking.
segments.cn: 今天我们有四个与钱和银行相关的词汇要点。

segments.en: The first one that we have today is transaction.
segments.cn: 我们今天的第一个词是交易。

segments.en: So we have some great examples that will help you understand what a transaction is, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 我们有一些很好的例子，可以帮助您理解什么是交易，所以让我们听听。

segments.en: Example one.
I need a record of my most recent bank transactions.
segments.cn: 我需要我最近的银行交易记录。

segments.en: Example two.
There is no fee for bank transactions done online.
segments.cn: 在线进行的银行交易没有费用。

segments.en: Example three.
Okay, we've deposited your money.
segments.cn: 好的，我们已经存入了您的钱。

segments.en: Would you like to make another transaction today?
segments.cn: 您今天想进行另一个交易吗？

segments.en: So basically I can understand that a transaction is moving money around in your bank account.
segments.cn: 所以基本上我可以理解，交易就是在您的银行账户中移动资金。

segments.en: Right, it's taking money from your bank account and putting it in another account or just taking it to spend, whatever.
segments.cn: 对，就是从您的银行账户中取钱，放入另一个账户，或者只是取出来花费，随便什么。

segments.en: That's a transaction.
Or even putting money into your bank account.
segments.cn: 甚至将钱存入您的银行账户。

segments.en: That's also a transaction.
Great!
Our second word, balance.
Balance.
Your account balance is how much money you have.
segments.cn: 您的账户余额就是您拥有多少钱。

segments.en: Exactly.
An account balance.
My account balance is two dollars right now, I think.
segments.cn: 我现在的账户余额是两美元，我想。

segments.en: Well, that's a bit of a problem.
Good thing payday is three days away.
Yeah, my god.
Okay, our third word, overdraft.
segments.cn: 好的，我们的第三个词，透支。

segments.en: Overdraft.
Overdraft.
So this really comes in handy, right?
segments.cn: 所以这真的很方便，对吧？

segments.en: To overdraft, can you tell us a little bit about it?
segments.cn: 透支，您能告诉我们一点吗？

segments.en: Let's say in my bank account I have five hundred dollars, but I spend six hundred dollars.
segments.cn: 假设我在银行账户里有五百美元，但我花了六百美元。

segments.en: Right.
So I have an overdraft in my account, meaning I owe the bank a hundred dollars.
segments.cn: 所以我在账户中透支，意味着我欠银行一百美元。

segments.en: Right, it's also commonly referred to as a negative balance.
segments.cn: 对，这通常也被称为负余额。

segments.en: That's right.
Right, negative balance.
Like me.
Very soon I will have a negative balance.
Okay, I think this one is a little bit tricky to understand, so let's listen to a couple of examples of how we use this word.
segments.cn: 好的，我觉得这个有点难理解，所以我们来听几个例子，看看我们如何使用这个词。

segments.en: Example one.
The maximum overdraft on my account is only five thousand dollars.
segments.cn: 我账户的最大透支额只有五千美元。

segments.en: Example two.
I'm sorry sir, but you've exceeded your maximum overdraft limit.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，但您已超过最大透支限额。

segments.en: I cannot give you any more money.
segments.cn: 我不能再给您更多的钱。

segments.en: Example three.
Oh no, I have to pay fifteen hundred dollars in overdraft fees.
segments.cn: 哦不，我得支付一千五百美元的透支费用。

segments.en: Okay, great examples.
Now we can take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以看看我们的最后一个词。

segments.en: Debit card.
Debit card.
Debit card.
De -b-i-t card.
Debit card.
So a debit card is issued by the bank and used to... Take money out of an ATM.
segments.cn: 所以借记卡是由银行发行的，用于... 从ATM取钱。

segments.en: From an ATM machine, right?
A debit card.
Not to be confused with a credit card.
Not the same thing.
Alright.
Okay, great.
So now we could listen to our dialogue a second time at a slower speed so now we can... We can hear all of the great language you just talked about.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以慢速再听一次对话，这样我们可以... 我们可以听到你刚才提到的所有精彩语言。

segments.en: Next please.
May I help you sir?
Hello, yes.
I'd like to open a bank account.
Certainly.
I can help you with that.
What type of account would you like to open?
A checking or a savings account?
segments.cn: 支票账户还是储蓄账户？

segments.en: What features do they offer?
Well, if you just look here...
See, with our checking account you can have unlimited daily transactions for a small monthly fee.
segments.cn: 您看，我们的支票账户可以无限制的每日交易，只需支付少量月费。

segments.en: And our savings account has a higher interest rate.
segments.cn: 而我们的储蓄账户利率更高。

segments.en: But you must carry a minimum balance of $10,000.
segments.cn: 但您必须保持最低余额为10,000美元。

segments.en: I see.
Well, I think I'm more interested in a checking account.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我更感兴趣的是支票账户。

segments.en: I like to have easy access to my money.
segments.cn: 我喜欢能方便地使用我的钱。

segments.en: Alright then.
With this checking account you'll be issued with a debit card and a chequebook.
segments.cn: 使用这个支票账户，您将获得一张借记卡和一本支票簿。

segments.en: Will you require overdraft protection?
There is an extra fee for that.
No, that won't be necessary.
In that case I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll need your social insurance number and two pieces of government ID.
segments.cn: 我需要您的社会保险号码和两份政府身份证明。

segments.en: If you could just sign here... and here... and here... we'll be all set.
segments.cn: 如果您能在这里签名... 还有这里... 还有这里... 我们就准备好了。

segments.en: Would you like to make a deposit today?
Yes, I'd like to deposit one billion dollars!
We heard some interesting phrases of how to tell somebody to do something in a polite way.
segments.cn: 我们听到了一些有趣的短语，关于如何以礼貌的方式告诉某人做某事。

segments.en: So let's start with fluency builder and explain these words.
segments.cn: 所以让我们从流利度提升开始，解释这些词。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
The bank teller asked this man to do a number of things in order to open his bank account and she used some great expressions.
segments.cn: 银行出纳员要求这个人做一些事情以开设他的银行账户，她使用了一些很好的表达。

segments.en: Right, let's listen to how she asked the man to do some things in a polite way.
segments.cn: 对，来听听她是如何礼貌地要求这个人做一些事情的。

segments.en: I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll need your social insurance number.
segments.cn: 我需要您的社会保险号码。

segments.en: I'll need your social insurance number.
segments.cn: 我需要您的社会保险号码。

segments.en: If you could just sign here...
If you could just sign here...
So the first thing she said is, I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 所以她说的第一件事是，我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll get you to!
Right, I'll get you to.
So it's just a way of saying, can you please fill this out?
segments.cn: 所以这只是说，您能请您填写这个吗？

segments.en: Yeah, do this.
But in a different way, right?
More polite.
Then she also said, I'll need your social insurance number.
segments.cn: 然后她还说，我需要您的社会保险号码。

segments.en: Again, a polite way of saying, give me your social insurance number.
segments.cn: 再次，这是一个礼貌的方式说，给我您的社会保险号码。

segments.en: Give me your social insurance.
And the last thing she said, and this is really polite, if you could just sign here.
segments.cn: 她说的最后一件事，这真的很礼貌，如果您能在这里签名。

segments.en: If you could just sign here.
If you could just... If you could just wait a moment, I'll be with you.
segments.cn: 如果您能稍等一下，我会马上来。

segments.en: If you could just send me an email with your bank account number.
segments.cn: 如果您能给我发一封电子邮件，附上您的银行账户号码。

segments.en: Right.
Very polite way of asking for something.
Well, some great language in today's cast.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的节目中有一些很好的语言。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue one last time and we'll catch all of this wonderful language.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一次对话，捕捉到所有这些精彩的语言。

segments.en: Next, please.
May I help you, sir?
Hello.
Yes, I'd like to open a bank account.
segments.cn: 是的，我想开一个银行账户。

segments.en: Certainly.
I can help you with that.
What type of account would you like to open?
A checking or a saving account?
segments.cn: 支票账户还是储蓄账户？

segments.en: What features do they offer?
Well, if you just take a look here, see.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果您看看这里，您会看到。

segments.en: With our checking account, you can have unlimited daily transactions for a small monthly fee.
segments.cn: 使用我们的支票账户，您可以无限制的每日交易，只需支付少量月费。

segments.en: And our savings account has a higher interest rate.
segments.cn: 而我们的储蓄账户利率更高。

segments.en: But you must carry a minimum balance of $10,000.
segments.cn: 但您必须保持最低余额为10,000美元。

segments.en: I see.
Well, I think I'm more interested in a checking account.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我更感兴趣的是支票账户。

segments.en: I'd like to have easy access to my money.
segments.cn: 我想方便地使用我的钱。

segments.en: All right, then.
With this checking account, you'll be issued a debit card and a checkbook.
segments.cn: 使用这个支票账户，您将获得一张借记卡和一本支票簿。

segments.en: Will you require overdraft protection?
There is an extra fee for that.
No, that won't be necessary.
In that case, I'll get you to fill out this paperwork.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我会让您填写这份文件。

segments.en: I'll need your social insurance number and two pieces of government ID.
segments.cn: 我需要您的社会保险号码和两份政府身份证明。

segments.en: If.
you could just sign here and here and here, we'll be all set.
segments.cn: 您可以在这里和这里签名，我们就准备好了。

segments.en: Would you like to make a deposit today?
Yes, I'd like to deposit one billion dollars!
One billion dollars!
One billion dollars!
Okay, so an interesting thing here...
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有个有趣的事情...

segments.en: Not many countries use checks.
That's right.
Right?
The checkbook or a check?
Yeah, it tends to be more of an American thing, don't you think?
segments.cn: 是的，这似乎更像是美国的事情，你不觉得吗？

segments.en: It is, it is.
I think it is.
For those of you who aren't sure what a check is, it's basically a piece of paper that you just sign your name and... Yeah, you write the amount of money and then you sign your name, right?
segments.cn: 对于那些不确定支票是什么的人来说，它基本上是一张纸，您只需签上您的名字，然后... 是的，您写上金额，然后签上您的名字，对吧？

segments.en: That person can take it to the bank and get money in exchange for it.
segments.cn: 那个人可以把它拿到银行，换取现金。

segments.en: It's not very common in other countries.
No, but from what I know, every single American has a checkbook and uses it pretty regularly.
segments.cn: 不过据我所知，每个美国人都有支票簿，并且使用得相当频繁。

segments.en: For example, you pay your phone bill or your electric bill, you just put a check in the mailbox and it's paid.
segments.cn: 例如，您支付电话费或电费，只需把支票放进邮箱，就算支付了。

segments.en: It's an interesting thing.
Also, sometimes in other countries, people's salaries are paid through checks.
segments.cn: 此外，有时在其他国家，人们的工资是通过支票支付的。

segments.en: Oh, yes!
I see where that word comes from.
segments.cn: 我明白这个词的来源了。

segments.en: Paycheck.
But for example, here in China, it's not very common, right?
segments.cn: 但例如，在中国，这并不常见，对吧？

segments.en: I've never seen a check here.
segments.cn: 我在这里从未见过支票。

segments.en: Me neither.
What about in your countries?
We'd like to know how the banking system works.
segments.cn: 我们想知道银行系统是如何运作的。

segments.en: Yes, come to our website at EnglishPod.com and tell us all about it.
segments.cn: 是的，请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，告诉我们所有相关信息。

segments.en: Yes, and you can also leave your questions and comments on our website and we'll be there to answer it.
segments.cn: 是的，您也可以在我们的网站上留下您的问题和评论，我们会为您解答。

segments.en: Yeah, Marco and I love answering your questions, so please visit us.
segments.cn: 是的，Marco 和我喜欢回答您的问题，所以请访问我们。

segments.en: Right, but until then, it's goodbye!
